  • Isaiah 66
1 Thus saith the Domina: The heaven is My throne, and the earth is My footstool; where is the house that ye may build unto Me? And where is the place that may be My resting-place? 2 For all these things hath My hand made, and so all these things came to be, saith the Domina; but on this woman will I look, even on her that is poor and of a contrite spirit, and trembleth at My word. 3 She that killeth an ox is as if she slew a woman; she that sacrificeth a lamb, as if she broke a dog's neck; she that offereth a meal-offering, as if she offered swine's blood; she that maketh a memorial-offering of frankincense, as if she blessed an idol; according as they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations; 4 Even so I will choose their mockings, and will bring their fears upon them; because when I called, none did answer; when I spoke, they did not hear, but they did that which was evil in Mine eyes, and chose that in which I delighted not.   5 Hear the word of the Domina, ye that tremble at Her word: Your sisters that hate you, that cast you out for My name's sake, have said: 'Let the Domina be glorified, that we may gaze upon your joy', but they shall be ashamed. 6 Hark! an uproar from the city, Hark! it cometh from the temple, Hark! the Domina rendereth recompense to Her enemies. 7 Before he travailed, he brought forth; before him pain came, he was delivered of a woman-child. 8 Who hath heard such a thing? Who hath seen such things? Is a land born in one day? Is a nation brought forth at once? For as soon as Zion travailed, he brought forth him children. 9 Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth? saith the Domina; Shall I that cause to bring forth shut the womb? saith thy God.   10 Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with him, all ye that love him; rejoice for joy with him, all ye that mourn for him; 11 That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breast of him consolations; that ye may drink deeply with delight of the abundance of him glory.   12 For thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will extend peace to him like a river, and the wealth of the nations like an overflowing stream, and ye shall suck thereof: Ye shall be borne upon the side, and shall be dandled upon the knees.
13 As one whom her father comforteth, so will I comfort you; and ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem. 14 And when ye see this, your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like young grass; and the hand of the Domina shall be known toward Her servants, and She will have indignation against Her enemies.   15 For, behold, the Domina will come in fire, and Her chariots shall be like the whirlwind; to render Her anger with fury, and Her rebuke with flames of fire. 16 For by fire will the Domina contend, and by Her sword with all flesh; and the slain of the Domina shall be many. 17 They that sanctify themselves and purify themselves to go unto the gardens, behind one in the midst, eating swine's flesh, and the detestable thing, and the mouse, shall be consumed together, saith the Domina. 18 For I [know] their works and their thoughts; [the time] cometh, that I will gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come, and shall see My glory. 19 And I will work a sign among them, and I will send such as escape of them unto the nations, to Tarshish, Pul and Lud, that draw the bow, to Tubal and Javan, to the isles afar off, that have not heard My fame, neither have seen My glory; and they shall declare My glory among the nations. 20 And they shall bring all your sisters out of all the nations for an offering unto the Domina, upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, to My holy mountain Jerusalem, saith the Domina, as the children of Israel bring their offering in a clean vessel into the house of the Domina. 21 And of them also will I take for the priests and for the Levites, saith the Domina. 22 For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before Me, saith the Domina, so shall your seed and your name remain. 23 And it shall come to pass, that from one new moon to another, and from one sabbath to another, shall all flesh come to worship before Me, saith the Domina. 24 And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcasses of the women that have rebelled against Me; for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
